respStmt.name: Craig A. Berry, Martin Mueller, and Clifford Wulfman
Lawrence Berland, Hilary Bina, Katherine Gould, Kreg Segal, Nicholas Terrell

publicationStmt.p: The WordHoard Shakespeare is a joint project of the Perseus Project at Tufts University, The Northwestern University Library, and Northwestern University Academic Technologies. It is derived from The Globe Shakespeare , the one-volume version of the Cambridge Shakespeare , edited by W. G. Clark, J. Glover, and W. A. Wright (1891-3). The Internet Shakespeare editions of the quartos and folios have been consulted to create a modern text that observes as closely as possible the morphological and prosodic practices of the earliest editions. Spellings, especially of contracted and hyphenated forms, have been standardized across the corpus. The text has been fully lemmatized and morphosyntactically tagged.

Â© 2003. The copyright to The WordHoard Shakespeare is owned jointly by Northwestern University and Tufts University. The WordHoard Shakespeare is provided for free solely for non-commercial use by students, scholars, and the public. Any commercial use or publication of it, in whole or in part, without prior written authorization of the copyright holders is strictly prohibited.

sourceDesc.p: The Wordhoard Shakespeare is derived from, but not identical with, The Globe Shakespeare , the one-volume version of the Cambridge Shakespeare (1891-3) edited by W. G. Clark, J. Glover, and W. A. Wright.

castGroup.head: Servants to the Countess of Rousillon

castItem.roleDesc: a gentlewoman protected by the Countess

castGroup.head: Neighbours and friends to the Widow

div.head: Act 1, Scene 1
div.stage: Enter BERTRAM, the COUNTESS OF Rossillion, HELENA, and LAFEU, all in black.

div.head: Act 1, Scene 2
div.stage: Enter the KING OF FRANCE, with letters, and divers Attendants.

div.head: Act 2, Scene 1
div.stage: Enter the KING, attended with divers young Lords taking leave for the Florentine war; BERTRAM, and PAROLLES.

sp.speaker: Bertram
sp.stage: Re-enter KING. BERTRAM and PAROLLES retire.

l.stage: Exeunt all but Lafeu and Parolles.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 1
div.stage: Enter the DUKE of Florence, attended; the two Frenchmen, with a troop of soldiers.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 3
div.stage: Enter the DUKE of Florence, BERTRAM, PAROLLES, Soldiers, Drum, and Trumpets.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 5
div.stage: Florence. Without the walls. A tucket afar off.
Enter an old Widow of Florence, DIANA, VIOLENTA, and MARIANA, with other Citizens.

sp.speaker: Widow
sp.stage: Enter HELENA, disguised like a Pilgrim.

l.stage: Enter BERTRAM, PAROLLES, and the whole army.

div.head: Act 3, Scene 6
div.stage: Enter BERTRAM and the two French Lords.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 1
div.stage: Enter Second French Lord, with five or six other Soldiers in ambush.

l.stage: Exit, with Parolles guarded. A short alarum within.

div.head: Act 4, Scene 3
div.stage: Enter the two French Lords and some two or three Soldiers.

sp.speaker: Second Lord
sp.stage: Enter PAROLLES guarded, and First Soldier.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 1
div.stage: Enter HELENA, Widow, and DIANA, with two Attendants.

div.head: Act 5, Scene 3
div.stage: Enter KING, COUNTESS, LAFEU, the two French Lords, with Attendants.
